Class DateRange

java.lang.Object
session.DateRange
public class DateRange extends Object
Encapsulates a date and a starting and ending time for an event. Dates should follow ISO 8601, which is YYYY-MM-DD (where YYYY is the 4 (or more)-digit year, MM is the 2-digit month (with a leading 0 if needed), and DD is the 2-digit day (with a leading 0 if needed).

Similarly, time should follow a 24-hour clock in the ISO 8601 format, which is HH:MM (where HH is 00 to 23 hours and MM is 00 to 59 minutes).

The start and end time are on the same date.

Since:
1.3
Version:
1.3
Author:
Prof Rice

  • Constructor Details

    • DateRange

      public DateRange(String date, String startTime, String endTime)
      Creates a DateRange given the date, start, and ending time. With this constructor, the starting and ending time are explicitly specified and the duration between them is calculated.
      Parameters:
      date - the date that includes both starting and ending time
      startTime - the starting time
      endTime - the ending time
      Since:
      1.3

    • DateRange

      public DateRange(String date, String startTime, long duration)
      Creates a DateRange given the date, starting time, and specific duration. With this constructor, the ending time is calculated from the starting time and the duration.
      Parameters:
      date - the date that includes both startTime and endTime
      startTime - the starting time
      duration - the number of minutes between startTime and endTime
      Since:
      1.3

    • DateRange

      public DateRange(Scanner in)

    • duration

      public long duration()
      Returns the difference between starting and ending time.
      Returns:
      the difference in starting and ending time in minutes
      Since:
      1.3

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Represents the date, starting and ending time, and duration. The format is as follows, where YYYY is the year, MM is the month, DD is the day, HH is the hour, MM is the minutes, and XX is the difference in minutes between starting and ending time.. 
      
YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM - HH:MM (XX minutes)
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the date, times, and duration
      Since:
      1.0

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Simple main method to explore the DateRange class.
      Parameters:
      args - the program arguments, currently ignored
      Since:
      1.0
